description.narrative: The Government Partnerships for Development Program (GPFD) provided funds to Australian Public Sector organisations to strengthen partnerships between themselves and their public sector counterparts in ODA eligible countries. Grants are awarded through an annual competitive process. GPFD Round One programs supported: regional management of climate change information in the Pacific; developing Myanmar's research capacity; small scale mining development in Indonesia; combatting gender-based violence and traifficking in Vietnam; maritime boundary elimination and marine spatial planning in the Pacific; and good practice regulation of services trade and investment in the APEC region. Programs supported under GPFD Round Two, opened for expressions of interest in March 2014 with projects commencing from November 2014, included: Supporting and strengthening Ombudsman and allied institutions to combat corruption in the Pacific; develop community-based waste recycling in Sri Lanka; improving hea
